str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Birth, lineage, descent. From the same as genea; nativity; figuratively, nature.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: To ask in marriage; pass: To be betrothed. From a derivative of mnaomai; to give a souvenir, i.e. Betroth.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.
